alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 8:31PM CDT until July 18 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHWESTERN LAWRENCE COUNTIES... At 831 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Moulton to near Phil Campbell to 9 miles southeast of Red Bay, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Phil Campbell, Vina, Hodges, Atwood, Duketon, Spruce Pine and western Bankhead National Forest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
